term.title: working electrode

item.text: An electrode that serves as a transducer responding to the excitation signal and the concentration of the substance of interest in the solution being investigated, and that permits the flow of current sufficiently large to effect appreciable changes of bulk composition within the ordinary duration of a measurement.

term.citation: Citation: 'working electrode' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.W06686

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
